(43) 354.2nd August, 1943.Copy No.WAR CABINET.STATISTICS RELATING TO BOMBER COMMAND operations during THE FIRST SIX MONTHS OF 1943.Note by the Prime Minister and Minister of Defence.MY colleagues may be interested by these figures, which deserve close attention. The economy of the Lancaster is paramount.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,2nd August, 1943.W. S. C.In the first six months of this year Bomber Command made 32,460 sorties,27,536 bombing and 3,132 sea-mining. Total casualties were 1,353, 4-4 per cent,on bombing (i.e., 1 every 23 sorties), 3-5 per cent, on sea-mining operations(i.e., 1 every 29 sorties). 64,300 tons of bombs were dropped on night raids, ofwhich 54,078 fell on Germany. On an average 1 bomber dropped 57 tons of bombs in its life. The following table shows the distribution of night effort onbomb raids and losses amongst our four main types. Bombs per Aircraft.
